questions.question_text: The enterprise goals defined in the COBIT framework are structured along which of the following dimensions?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Balanced scorecard

questions.question_text: Which COBIT design factor is broken down into first mover, follower and laggard strategies?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Technology adoption

questions.question_text: The alignment goal titled "Competent and motivated staff with mutual understanding of technology and business" is part of which IT balanced scorecard (BSQ) dimension?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Learning and growth

Selected Answer: C
C is correct. COBIT 2019 Framework reference: AG12 -> IT BSC Dimension: Learning and Growth -> Alignment Goal: Competent and motivated staff with mutual understanding of technology and business
Figure 6â€”Results Showing Mapped Data Values of COBIT 2019 Results from Alignment Goals to Enterprise Goals

Selected Answer: C
C. Business service continuity and availability

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an enterprise goal according to COBIT?

choices.B: How well a process is implemented and performing at a given level
choices.A: Who is responsible for ensuring all activities at a given level are performed successfully
choices.C: Which internal policies are relevant to a process at a given level

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. How well a process is implemented and performing at a given level

questions.question_text: Which of the following is determined at each level of a capability maturity model?
